inference:
The wall is 8 feet high and 6 feet wide, so it has an area of 48 square feet. Each roof face is 8 feet wide and 5 feet tall, so each has an area of 40 square feet. The total area to be covered is \(48 + 2(40) = 128\) square feet. Since each section of siding is 8 feet by 12 feet, or 96 square feet, Sandy will need 128/96 = 1.333... sections of siding. Since she can't buy a fraction of a section, she will need to buy 2 sections. The cost of 2 sections will be 2($27.30) = \\$54.60.
Final Answer: \\boxed{$54.60}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Sandy will need to cover an $8$ by $6$ rectangle and two $8$ by $5$ rectangles. Thus, she will need to have at her disposal a sheet that is $8$ by $16$, so she should buy two $8$ by $12$ feet sections. The total price will be $2 \cdot \$ 27.30 = \boxed{ \$ 54.60}$.

question:
The wall is 8 feet high and 6 feet wide, so it has an area of 48 square feet. Each roof face is 8 feet wide and 5 feet tall, so each has an area of 40 square feet. The total area to be covered is \(48 + 2(40) = 128\) square feet. Since each section of siding is 8 feet by 12 feet, or 96 square feet, Sandy will need 128/96 = 1.333... sections of siding. Since she can't buy a fraction of a section, she will need to buy 2 sections. The cost of 2 sections will be 2($27.30) = \\$54.60.
Final Answer: \\boxed{$54.60}. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth: Sandy will need to cover an $8$ by $6$ rectangle and two $8$ by $5$ rectangles. Thus, she will need to have at her disposal a sheet that is $8$ by $16$, so she should buy two $8$ by $12$ feet sections. The total price will be $2 \cdot \$ 27.30 = \boxed{ \$ 54.60}$.
